intro: Rinorea lankawiensis, commonly known as the Lankawi Rinorea, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Langkawi in Malaysia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
